title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Refinery Off-Gases to Ethanol Project, through LanzaTech, Inc.

description.narrative: This feasibility study (FS) grant partially funds setting up an ethanol conversion plant at the Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL)'s Panipat oil refinery. The plant will be based on the sole-source U.S. contractor LanzaTech's proprietary process to convert refinery off-gases to ethanol that will be blended with transportation fuels. Once implemented, the project will produce fuel-grade ethanol from waste gases, reduce carbon emissions in vehicles using the ethanol blend transportation fuel, and reduce particulate emissions at the refinery.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - 2023 U.S.-India Aviation Summit, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: The 2023 U.S.-India Aviation Summit will bring together senior representatives from the public and private sectors of India and the United States to bolster long-term strategic and commercial aviation cooperation. The Summit will consist of a one or two-day symposium, one day of site visits and off-site meetings, and a meeting of the U.S.-India Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP). The Summit will serve as a commercial, technical, and policy forum to assist civil aviation authorities and aviation industry representatives from India in identifying and specifying advanced U.S. technologies and practices best suited for their expansion and modernization needs. The Summit will address key issues related to aviation safety and security, air traffic management and control, airport and airline operations, sustainable aviation fuels and environmental best practices, procurement and financing options, and other aviation topics.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Climate Technologies Action Group Emissions Reduction Reverse Trade Mission and Workshop, through E4 Carolinas

description.narrative: This contract funds a reverse trade mission (RTM) and workshop to introduce Indian delegates from the government and private sectors to U.S. technology, regulations and best practices in emissions reduction, with a focus on the energy sector under the U.S.India Climate Technologies Action Group (CTAG), convened by USTDA and the U.S.India Strategic Partnership Forum. The delegates will travel to up to three cities in the U.S. to meet with U.S. companies and conduct site visits to see American technology manufactured and in use, followed by a one-day workshop in India with up to 100 participants to identify specific projects for implementation following the RTM.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Airport Geographic Information System, through Government of India

description.narrative: This $497,888 grant supports technical assistance (TA) for the Airports Authority of India (AAI) to develop and test a prototype Airport Geographic Information System (AGIS). AAI and Hi-Tec Systems, Inc., (Hi-Tec) jointly proposed this sole-source project to USTDA as a priority for the U.S.-India Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP). AGIS can store aeronautical geographic information in an electronic format, which can be updated, edited, and shared within AAI as well as with other airports, regulators, and contractors in India's civil aviation realm, increasing overall sector efficiencies. The TA will ultimately develop a prototype system for one medium-sized airport in India as a proof of concept for future customization, deployment, and application of AGIS technologies for other airports in the country.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Aviation Safety, through Government of India

description.narrative: This $1,543,445 technical assistance (TA) grant is assisting India's Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) to enhance its aviation safety regulatory framework and oversight capabilities. The TA aims to advance India's regulatory safety oversight system to the point at which it can satisfy findings from the 2013 U.S. Federal Aviation Administration International Aviation Safety Assessment audit that led to the country's Category 1 downgrade. The Contractor will examine and propose revisions to various aspects of DGCA's regulations, systems, and practices, including but not limited to the agency's workforce evaluation methodology and current staffing levels; inspector training program and tracking system; air carrier certification and special authorization processes; oversight of designated examiners; as well as its surveillance, safety resolution, and enforcement actions.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - Aviation Security Workshop, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: The Aviation Security Workshop addressed key issues related to the planning and implementation of airport security equipment and procedures in India. In partnership with the U.S.-India Aviation Cooperation Program, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), and the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), USTDA organized and executed a two-day event that took place in New Delhi, India in March 2013. The event targeted public and private sector participants from the United States and India, who engaged in discussions on best practices and explored opportunities for commercial linkages in aviation security.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - ENERGY SECTOR - NATIONAL GAS GRID, through Government of India

description.narrative: USTDA is funding $690,000 for a $920,000 National Gas Grid Feasibility Study. The Feasibility Study evaluates technologies and practices for the construction, operation and management of a proposed $4.3 billion natural gas transmission pipeline network that will eventually reach all major energy consuming areas in India. The project will involve construction of about 7,900 km of line along with a number of compressor stations and metering stations, gas storage, control systems and communications. The Government of India has identified this project as a major component of its long-term energy policy. The export potential for U.S. firms is estimated at $960 million, including the supply of compressor stations, metering stations, SCADA systems and communications, as well as in project management and design and engineering services.

This project will directly support regulatory initiatives in India at the national level through judicial mandates requiring fuel clean-up nation wide.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL OFFICER LONG-TERM PLANNING, through Government of India

description.narrative: USTDA support of $62,160 funds 50 percent of the cost of technical assistance to provide an expert U.S. assessment of the Airport Authority of India's (AAI) draft Long-Term Manpower Requirements Plan for Air Traffic Control Officers (ATCOs). The hiring and training of new air traffic control officers and the modernization of existing officer capabilities is a critical need for the Grantee, AAI, in maintaining safety standards as it meets its current and anticipated growth and prepares for a major air traffic control modernization program. The project is expected to lead the way to direct procurement of additional U.S. services for manpower assessments, licensing and training programs for the air traffic control sector in India with a special focus on review of manpower requirements for several large, strategic facilities for the aviation sector. This future work would serve as an important first step towards U.S. involvement in the development of these critical facilities with extensive potential for the use of U.S. goods and services.

title.narrative: Behavioral Energy Efficiency Program, through Oracle Corporation

description.narrative: This feasibility study (FS) and pilot project provides partial funding to develop a pilot Behavioral Energy Efficiency (BEE) program for BSES Rajdhani Power Limited (BRPL) in Delhi. The program will encourage BRPL and its electric customers to optimize energy services and save energy by analyzing customers' energy consumption and providing customers with customized information so they can take specific action to use energy more efficiently; information will be provided through Home Energy Reports (HERs) and a website portal. The objective of this FS is to develop, pilot and demonstrate the first BEE program in India, and help prove the business and regulatory case for using consumption analytics and customer engagement to save electricity and reduce peak demand, which in turn will reduce costs for utilities and customers, and promote sustainable system growth.

title.narrative: U.S.-India Standards and Conformance Cooperation Program (SCCP) Phase II, through American National Standards Institute

description.narrative: This technical assistance (TA) grant supports a second phase of the U.S-India Standards and Conformance Cooperation Program (SCCP) working with the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), India's premier business association. Building upon the success of the first phase of SCCP, this program will help expand and improve India's overall trading capacity by familiarizing representatives from Indian standards-setting bodies and industry with U.S. and international best practices in standards-setting and conformity assessment. Phase II will focus on the continued development of the Standards Portal, and will include six standards and conformance focused workshops for three sectors vital to the U.S.-India trade: smart and sustainable cities, water and sanitation, and clean energy.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Sustainable Master Planning For The Kolkata And Lucknow International Airports, through Landrum & Brown, Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance (TA) grant to the Airports Authority of India (AAI) will deliver a twenty-year master and capital improvement plans to sustainably expand the operational capacities of the Kolkata and Lucknow International Airports. Landrum & Brown will conduct the master planning, which will incorporate environmental sustainability best practices, to accommodate the anticipated demand at two of the fastest growing airports within AAI's network. This no-cost amendment would amend the Sustainable Master Planning for the Kolkata and Udaipur Airports TA for the AAI. The amendment would update the title of the grant to Sustainable Master Planning for the Kolkata, Lucknow and Udaipur Airports to reflect the change of the second airport to Udaipur. The amendment would also change the Contractor to Landrum & Brown, Inc. Under this TA, Landrum & Brown will deliver master and capital improvement plans to sustainably expand the operational capacities of two airports in AAIs network.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - RURAL MICRO-GRID SOLAR POWER, through Government of India

description.narrative: This $476,670 grant funds a competed feasibility study (FS) for Azure Power ("Azure") for the development of a Rural Micro-Grid Solar Power project that will be deployed in remote non-electrified villages in India. The FS provides technological and economic assessments, EPC cost estimates, and project implementation planning.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE EXCHANGE, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This $459,859 Transportation Infrastructure Exchange Program brings Indian officials and project sponsors to the U.S. for a series of two reverse trade missions (RTM) focused on the ports and rail sectors. The objective of this program is to familiarize members of the delegation with U.S. infrastructure technologies and facilitate business partnerships between U.S. companies and the public and private sectors of India.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - EMERGENCY RESPONSE (RTM), through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: This $213,484 Reverse Trade Mission brings representatives of the Ministry of Home Affairs and the National Disaster Management Authority and state and municipal officials to the U.S. to meet with U.S. companies active in the emergency management sector and U.S. governmental agencies at several levels. The Indian authorities currently are developing Emergency Operation Centers (EOCs) and developing a range of improved emergency management capabilities and related infrastructure, presenting opportunities for U.S. firms in this sector.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - CESC SMART GRID, through Government of India

description.narrative: This $618,860 grant funds a feasibility study (FS) for smart grid implementation in India. The FS provides an assessment of smart grid integration into the existing 2.5 million customer Calcutta Electric Supply Corporation (CESC) system and is designed to improve the efficiency of India's power distribution networks.

title.narrative: Desk Study - INDIAN RAILWAYS TECHNOLOGIES AND PROCESSES, through Seneca Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $7,000 Desk Study reviews a proposal for a Feasibility Study for Indian Railways. The proposed study will assess the technological, economic, and financial requirements needed to support upgrades in technology and systems operations in Indian Railways' passenger and freight rail systems.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - ACP AVIATION SECTOR PROJECTS, through KED Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $75,000 Definitional Mission (DM) to India engages member companies of the US.-India Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP) in the identification and evaluation of aviation sector projects for USTDA funding consideration.
